page.title: 01GENERAL DESCRIPTION
page.content: Landscape: The area mainly consists of farmland and some woodland.It covers 3 parishes Romsley,Hunnington,Frankley and in NE, Kitwell Estate,part of Birmingham.In the SW is Romsley Village joined by ribbon development through Hunnington almost to Halesowen.Although roads bound the central area,mostly in Frankley,access to the centre is along farm,public or bridle paths.The land slopes from 300m above Romsley to 150m in the N.The M5 dissects the area with a service station at Frankley.A single track railway with a station in Hunnington,closed in 1964. There are 3 distinctive built up areas, Kitwell Est., part of Frankley Est.(Birmingham overspill)plus Frankley rural area and Romsley/Hunnington;these will be dealt with separately in the following pages.
